chapters.title: How to Talk About Personality Types

words.definition: Me first; believes in self-advancement above all else
words.exampleSentence: The egoist only thinks about what benefits himself.

words.definition: The height of conceit; constantly talks about own accomplishments
words.exampleSentence: The egotist couldn't stop talking about his achievements.

words.definition: Let me help you; interested in the welfare of others
words.exampleSentence: The altruist donated all her savings to charity.

words.definition: Leave me alone; turns thoughts inward
words.exampleSentence: As an introvert, she preferred reading alone to attending parties.

words.definition: Let's do it together; turns thoughts outward
words.exampleSentence: The extrovert was the life of every party.

words.definition: Neither extreme; both introverted and extroverted tendencies
words.exampleSentence: Most people are ambiverts, comfortable in both social and solitary situations.

words.definition: People are no damn good; hates mankind
words.exampleSentence: The misanthrope lived in a cabin miles away from the nearest town.

words.definition: Women are no damn good; hates women
words.exampleSentence: His misogynist views were offensive to everyone in the room.

words.definition: Marriage is an institutionâ€”and who wants to live in an institution?; hates marriage
words.exampleSentence: As a confirmed misogamist, he refused to ever settle down.

words.definition: That the flesh is heir to; practices severe self-discipline
words.exampleSentence: The ascetic lived on rice and water and slept on the floor.

items.question: Who lives by the motto 'Me First'?
Which word describes someone who is primarily interested in the welfare of others?
Which word describes a person who hates women?
Who turns thoughts both inward and outward?

words.definition: Considering oneself the center of the universe; extreme selfishness
words.exampleSentence: His egocentric worldview made it hard for him to empathize with others.

words.definition: Obsessively and morbidly wrapped up in oneself
words.exampleSentence: The dictator was a dangerous egomaniac.

words.definition: The philosophy of putting another's welfare above one's own
words.exampleSentence: Her altruism led her to volunteer in the disaster zone.

words.definition: To take turns; skip one and take the other
words.exampleSentence: We generally alternate who drives to work.

words.definition: A heated or angry dispute; a verbal argument
words.exampleSentence: They got into a loud altercation over the parking spot.

words.definition: One's other self; a very close friend
words.exampleSentence: Batman is Bruce Wayne's alter ego.

items.question: Which word implies you consider yourself the center of the universe?
What is a noisy, heated argument called?
What term refers to your 'other self'?

words.definition: Skillful, especially with the hands
words.exampleSentence: The dexterous surgeon performed the delicate operation perfectly.

words.definition: Able to use both hands with equal skill
words.exampleSentence: The ambidextrous pitcher could throw with either arm.

words.definition: Evil, threatening, or ominous (originally 'left-handed')
words.exampleSentence: There was something sinister about the dark, abandoned house.

words.definition: Socially awkward; tactless (literally 'left')
words.exampleSentence: It was gauche of him to ask about her salary.

words.definition: Skillful, clever, or quick-witted (literally 'right')
words.exampleSentence: She was adroit at handling difficult customers.

words.definition: The study of human development and history
words.exampleSentence: He majored in anthropology to study ancient cultures.

words.definition: Love of mankind; charitable giving
words.exampleSentence: Her philanthropy supported libraries across the country.

words.definition: The practice of having only one spouse at a time
words.exampleSentence: Monogamy is the standard in many cultures.

words.definition: The unlawful act of marrying someone while already married
words.exampleSentence: He was arrested for bigamy after his second wife found out about the first.

words.definition: The practice of having multiple spouses at once
words.exampleSentence: Polygamy is illegal in most Western countries.

items.question: Which word describes being able to use both hands equally well?
Which word means socially awkward or tactless?
What is the love of mankind through charity?

words.definition: Specialist in internal medicine and diagnosis
words.exampleSentence: The internist gave her a complete physical examination.

words.definition: Specialist in female reproductive health
words.exampleSentence: She scheduled an appointment with her gynecologist.

words.definition: Specialist who delivers babies
words.exampleSentence: The obstetrician was on call for the delivery.

words.definition: Specialist in the care of infants and children
words.exampleSentence: The pediatrician checked the baby's weight.

words.definition: Specialist in skin diseases
words.exampleSentence: The dermatologist treated his acne.

words.definition: Eye surgeon and specialist
words.exampleSentence: The ophthalmologist prescribed new glasses.

words.definition: Specialist in skeletal system and bones
words.exampleSentence: The orthopedist set the broken leg.

words.definition: Specialist in heart diseases
words.exampleSentence: The cardiologist monitored his heart rate.

words.definition: Specialist in nervous system and brain
words.exampleSentence: The neurologist performed a reflex test.

words.definition: Specialist in mental ailments and emotional disturbances
words.exampleSentence: The psychiatrist helped him manage his depression.

items.question: Which doctor treats bone and skeletal issues?

words.definition: Medical specialty concerning children
words.exampleSentence: She decided to specialize in pediatrics.

words.definition: The principles and methods of teaching
words.exampleSentence: The professor was an expert in pedagogy.

words.definition: A leader who appeals to people's prejudices and emotions
words.exampleSentence: The demagogue riled up the crowd with angry rhetoric.

words.definition: Study of the skin
words.exampleSentence: Dermatology deals with everything from rashes to skin cancer.

words.definition: Stuffing of skins of animals
words.exampleSentence: The museum featured excellent taxidermy.

words.definition: Related to the eye
words.exampleSentence: He suffered from ocular strain after staring at the screen.

words.definition: A single eyeglass lens
words.exampleSentence: The old gentleman wore a monocle.

items.question: What is the art or principle of teaching?
Who leads by appealing to prejudice and emotion?

words.definition: Straightening of teeth
words.exampleSentence: She needed orthodontia to fix her crooked smile.

words.definition: Relating to the heart
words.exampleSentence: He suffered a cardiac arrest.

words.definition: Record of heart beats
words.exampleSentence: The cardiogram showed an irregular rhythm.

words.definition: Emotional disturbance or disorder
words.exampleSentence: His obsession with cleanliness bordered on neurosis.

words.definition: Study of the nervous system
words.exampleSentence: Neurology is a complex field requiring years of study.

items.question: What term describes an emotional disturbance?
